India Should Have Carefully Reviewed Complete Shutdown, Says Yamaha ...  said the complete closure of economic activities should have been reviewed carefully in a large country like India. A proper road map should also have been planned to handle the coronavirus pandemic in the country said the two-wheeler player, according to Motofumi Shitara, chairman at Yamaha Motor India. The company, which has three plants in the country, said saving human lives is the top priority for any nation but economic activities should not be shut completely. "We must remember that India is one of the world's largest economies and is also the world's largest two-wheeler market.
